PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Figure 7 shows the current - voltage ( J-V ) characteristics of the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al devices.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| current - voltage (J-V) |
| ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al |

The two "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are:

1. "current - voltage (J-V)": This refers to the relationship between the current and voltage of a device, which is often used to characterize its electrical properties.
2. "ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al": This is a description of the layers in the device being characterized, with each layer separated by a slash. ITO likely stands for Indium Tin Oxide, PEDOT : PSS for Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) poly(styrenesulfonate), PC71BM for Phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester, LiF for Lithium Fluoride, and Al for Aluminum.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| current - voltage (J-V) |

After reviewing the paragraph, I have determined that there is only one clear "Value of material property" entity in the text:

1. "current - voltage (J-V)": This refers to the relationship between the current and voltage of a device, which is a material property that can be used to characterize the electrical behavior of the device.

The other entity in the paragraph, "ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al", is a description of the layers in the device being characterized, but it does not clearly refer to a specific material property. Therefore, it has been excluded from the table.
